) IRS employees can disclose return information to seek advice about legal, technical, or procedural issues in a speciﬁc case. However, a “need to know” must be established on a case by case basis. (

) When return information is appropriately disclosed to obtain legal, technical procedural assistance, or to demonstrate investigative or enforcement tech- niques, IRS employees should not disclose taxpayers’ identities unless it is necessary. In some cases, withholding the taxpayer’s name would be suffi- cient, while in others, it may be necessary to withhold certain case facts which identify the taxpayer.
